author: samyxandy
content:
regarding 
https://gist.github.com/zsfelfoldi/73d9053f75c28a8461d13e0b61a58f1c
here are a few questions from my side

- for the txn or log values 0 or 1 maybe we use prog containers ?
- like you mentioned for zk maybe use a different hashing 
lean is using ssz with poseidon-2 (https://eprint.iacr.org/2023/323 https://www.poseidon-initiative.info/)
we could adapt that ?
- from what i see 
for history proofs we are bound the amount of table we want to store into the log index 

say for 64 the tree could only have a proof for say the blocks for some say arbtiary topic
so the consensus vs proofhistory access details need more data ?
- any metrics on how fast the new data structure is compared to filtermaps is ?
-  imo the hashing sceme for the 64 byte thing can be optimised not sure about that but i do feel we could do some wizady here
- for history maybe we could do something like the original design of filtermaps where the history related part gets the async treatment ?(just a opinion but i do see similarities between the filtermaps over the epoc -> dividing them -> keeping only the recent ones -> allowing history proofs in some sort of manner for the entire history and not just 

- really liked the table idea as those who care can generate the proofs they need but for the nodes that dont care about history or say serving rpc only care about processing the latest x amount of block
- however the idea of the zk proof for x thing over history seems just an idea without any direction

author: samyxandy
content:
also i was working on a benchmarking setup ideated by <@571701739028217885> 

where we could run the different designs against each other and also a baseline implemntation of a modified bloom filter to have numbers about size vs access time tradeoffs

author: samyxandy
content:
also imo
